Internal.description: An internal server error with a proprietary message.

NotFound.description: To be used if the requested resource does not exist. Note: There are specialized errors for missing jobs (JobNotFound), files (FileNotFound), etc. Unsupported endpoints MAY send an 'FeatureUnsupported' (501) error.

FeatureUnsupported.description: The back-end responds with this error whenever an endpoint is specified in the openEO API, but is not supported.

InfrastructureMaintenance.description: Service is currently not available as the infrastructure is currently undergoing maintenance work.
InfrastructureMaintenance.message: Service is not available at the moment due to maintenance work. Please try again later or contact our support.

InfrastructureBusy.description: Service is generally available, but the infrastructure can't handle it at the moment as too many requests are processed.
InfrastructureBusy.message: Service is not available at the moment due to overloading. Please try again later or contact our support.

UnsupportedApiVersion.description: The service doesn't support the openEO API version specified in the request URL. Clients should check well-known document for supported versions.
UnsupportedApiVersion.message: The requested API version '{version}' is not supported.

RequestTimeout.description: The request took too long and timed out.

BudgetInvalid.description: The budget is too low as it is either smaller than or equal to 0 or below the costs.
BudgetInvalid.message: The specified budget is too low.

NoDataForUpdate.description: For PATCH requests: No valid data specified at all.
NoDataForUpdate.message: No data specified to be updated.

PropertyNotEditable.description: For PATCH requests: The specified parameter can't be updated. It is read-only.

CollectionNotFound.description: The requested collection does not exist.

StorageFailure.description: Server couldn't store file(s) due to server-side reasons.
StorageFailure.message: Unable to store files due to a server error. Please try again later or contact our support.

StorageQuotaExceeded.description: The storage quota has been exceeded by the user.
StorageQuotaExceeded.message: Your storage quota has been exceeded.

FileNotFound.description: The requested file does not exist.

FilePathInvalid.description: The specified path is invalid or not accessible. Path could contain invalid characters, point to an existing folder or a location outside of the user folder.

FileOperationUnsupported.message: The file operation is not supported for the specified path.

FolderOperationUnsupported.description: The specified path is a folder and the operation is only supported for files.
FolderOperationUnsupported.message: Operation is only supported for files, not folders.

ContentTypeInvalid.description: The specified media (MIME) type used in the Content-Type header is not allowed.
ContentTypeInvalid.message: The media type is not supported. Allowed: {types}

FileTypeInvalid.description: File format or file extension is not allowed.
FileTypeInvalid.message: File format {type} not allowed. Allowed file formats: {types}

FileSizeExceeded.description: File exceeds allowed maximum file size.
FileSizeExceeded.message: File size it too large. Maximum file size: {size}

FileContentInvalid.description: The content of the file is invalid.

FileLocked.description: The file is locked by a running job or another process.
FileLocked.message: File '{file}' is locked by another process.

ProcessGraphNotFound.description: The requested user-defined process does not exist. To be used for all endpoints starting with `/process_graphs`.

ProcessGraphMissing.description: The parameter `process` doesn't contain a valid process.

ProcessGraphIdDoesntMatch.description: If a user-defined process is stored and the ID in the request path and the JSON document are not equal.
ProcessGraphIdDoesntMatch.message: The ids in the path and in the document don't match.

PredefinedProcessExists.description: If a user wants to store a user-defined process with the id of a predefined process.
PredefinedProcessExists.message: A predefined process with the given identifier exists.

ProcessGraphComplexity.description: The process graph is too complex for synchronous processing and will likely time out. Please use a batch job instead.
ProcessGraphComplexity.message: The process is too complex for for synchronous processing. Please use a batch job instead.

ProcessUnsupported.description: A process (predefined or user-defined) with the specified identifier is not available. To be used when validating or executing process graphs.
ProcessUnsupported.message: Process with identifier '{process}' is not available in namespace '{namespace}'.

ProcessParameterInvalid.message: The value passed for parameter '{parameter}' in process '{process}' is invalid: {reason}

JobNotFound.description: The requested job does not exist.
JobNotFound.message: The batch job '{identifier}' does not exist.

JobLocked.description: The job is currently locked due to a running batch computation and can't be modified meanwhile.
JobLocked.message: Batch job is locked due to a queued or running batch computation.

JobNotFinished.message: Batch job has not finished computing the results yet. Please try again later or contact our support.

JobNotStarted.description: Job has not been queued or started yet or was canceled and not restarted by the user.
JobNotStarted.message: Batch job must be started first.

ResultLinkExpired.description: The signed URLs for batch job results have expired. Please send a request to `GET /jobs/{job_id}/results` to refresh the links.
ResultLinkExpired.message: The link to the batch job result has expired. Please request the results again.

PaymentRequired.description: The budget required to fulfil the request is insufficient.
PaymentRequired.message: The budget required to fulfil the request is not sufficient. A payment is required first.

BillingPlanInvalid.description: The billing plan is not on the list of available plans.

AuthenticationRequired.description: The client did not provide any authentication details for a resource requiring authentication or the provided authentication details are not correct.

TokenInvalid.message: Authorization token has expired or is invalid. Please authenticate again.

PermissionsInsufficient.description: Forbidden. The client did provided correct authentication details, but the privileges/permissions of the provided credentials do not allow to request the resource.
PermissionsInsufficient.message: Forbidden. The permissions of the authenticated account do not allow to request the requested resource.

ServiceNotFound.description: The requested secondary service does not exist.

ServiceConfigUnsupported.description: Refers to the secondary service `configuration` object.

ServiceConfigInvalid.description: Refers to the secondary service `configuration` object.
ServiceConfigInvalid.message: The value passed for the service parameter '{parameter}' is invalid: {reason}

ServiceConfigRequired.description: Refers to the secondary service `configuration` object.
